name: excavation
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the act of removing earth that is covering very old objects buried in the ground in order to discover things about the past: Three skulls and one full skeleton were discovered during the excavation of an Egyptian tomb. She has taken part in several excavations of Roman settlements across Europe.
the act of digging a hole or channel in the ground, especially with a machine: The site has been undergoing demolition and excavation since August.excavation work Construction companies acknowledge the danger of excavation work. See
excavate
More examplesFewer examplesExcavation on the site is likely to continue for several years.Recent excavations reveal that the ancient city of Pompeii suffered several devastating landslides.His boyhood memories included the excavation for the railway tunnel to Union Station.
